website_summaries.verdict: The industrial form-factor is cool, but its large storage capacity and lightning-speed makes this a worthy PS4 external hard drive.

customer_reviews.title: WD Black 12TB
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't the best deal per TB but after trading up from a 4TB I wanted to increase my external HDD storage just one more time for my Xbox One. It was easy to transfer the contents of my old HDD to this new one using the Xbox One and thus far the new drive is performing well. Overall the price is OK but I will be miffed if its dicounted in the near future. Currently the 8TB is better value but obviously smaller capacity in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. W. F. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Faster than expected.
customer_reviews.text: This handy drive replaced a 2TB Passport Ultra edition drive due to capacity. The P10 Black drive is a solid 40% faster than the Passport Ultra - a very nice (unexpected) bonus. P10 5TB gets my recommendations.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Impressive 8 TB drive.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to connect up my Asus router's USB 3 interface port. Giving me an impressive server network of almost 8 Tera Bytes ( never get the full amount due to file allocation tables occupying some space ). Also the drive transfer speed is very good with no noticeable delay after accessing the drive through my network when transferring data, though obviously WiFi transfer rates are lower than direct cable connection. Good drive operating at 7200rpm, not the slower 5400 rpm as found on other models. As yet I haven't found any negative points, but it's still early days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well but it's noisy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these as an upgrade from the 8tb Xbox Seagate External HDD. Whilst the extra 4tb of space comes in handy this WD_Black drive is SO noisy. If you don't NEED the full 12tb and the noise will miff you off, then I'd suggest going with an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Chapman

customer_reviews.title: gamepass codes out of date ! Faults !
customer_reviews.text: *they have since fixed the code issue through wd customer support* I've never had more issues with a product the 3 months gold is out of date and the hard drive will not let you play games that are installed on it while you are installing a game or update to the drive I don't know if its because mine is faulty or if everyone has the same issue, WD customer support gave me an extra set of codes but they were also out of date and I haven't had a response since stay away choose seagate
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: 5gb and works on ps4 pro
customer_reviews.text: Excellent external storage bought for ps4 pro. After connecting via usb just follow the online wizard and it will format the drive to be used with Ps4. Ideally you want an external drive that is permenantly connected to ps4 and not to be used to store other data. I chose the 5gb model as game data is far too big these days. Modern warfare takes the p*** when it comes to storage, assuming black ops cold war will be similar. All in all very happy with purchase. I have mine connected to the back of console as have a usb slot on ps4 pro model.
customer_reviews.author: Ansar Hussain

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a superb solution to game storage. You can store a vast number of games on here, and play them from the drive. The Games you play while stored on this USB drive play as well as they do as If they were stored locally on the Xbox (built in) drive.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart Marsden

customer_reviews.title: Fast, but not 2,000MB/s fast...
customer_reviews.text: Its fast but not as fast as specified, only reaching 920MB/s via USB-C on my 2017 MacBook Pro and 360MB/s on my 2013 MacPro via USB3, it also runs quite warm in extended use.
customer_reviews.author: C Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Good performance. Looks good.
customer_reviews.text: This performs well and looks good with the Xbox. Although you could buy a standard external hdd a bit cheaper the fact this comes with some gamepass helps narrow the price difference.
customer_reviews.author: hannibalhorn

customer_reviews.title: Good drive.
customer_reviews.text: Quite light but nice and strong metal case, copy’s at around 120Mb/s which is the normal speed for a spinning drive. Good for backups and storage. Can hardly hear it spinning and has the usual led indicator idiot light.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: It's got a good feel and seems like it would last a while. Internally I think it's nothing special and only 10% faster than the cheapest hard drives on the market.
customer_reviews.author: joted

customer_reviews.title: Well made and not a bad price
customer_reviews.text: It look very well made, high quality in a metal casing, works well with the PC its just plug and play. Does exactly what it claims and the Gamer Son is happy.
customer_reviews.author: MummyandMe

customer_reviews.title: Great storage - noisy and runs hot
customer_reviews.text: I like the capacity and speed - don't like the noise and the fact that even when not active it runs at 50c and has gone as high as 64c in use
customer_reviews.author: M. Meltzer

customer_reviews.title: not what stated on AD.
customer_reviews.text: Not the capacity advertised was 4.5 not 5 understand normally drives are slightly under advertised size to account for formatting but not half a terabyte.
customer_reviews.author: Joolswang

customer_reviews.title: Not included - 3 months XBOX Unlimited pass
customer_reviews.text: Received this hard drive 30 minutes ago. Decided to return it as the code for 3 Months of XBOX Game Pass Unltimate expired. On the box is small label with info the code should be redeemed before 20/6/2020. Shame.
customer_reviews.author: Tomag2345

customer_reviews.title: Fast but loud!
customer_reviews.text: Great storage hard drive for large game collections, very fast for a mechanical hard drive. Does get a bit clicky or knocky at times but that's the trade off I guess you make for the extra speed.
customer_reviews.author: jodie

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: Performs as expected for a portable hard drive. I would have liked to see a usb c instead of micro usb3 but it works. works well on windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Top quality, top capacity
customer_reviews.text: Great quality drive 5tb in a 2.5 inch form, what's not to love. Its no ssd, but great for storage of large files
customer_reviews.author: jodie

customer_reviews.title: 4.5TB?
customer_reviews.text: All though this drive says it’s 5TB but really it’s 4.5TB but since it’s bigger than my current drive I won’t complain
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Best and fastest external hard disk good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and super fast. Good value for money compared to current ssd costs. This is about 50-25% slower than most ssd and at a fraction of the costs. Good investment
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value for such a huge disk size
customer_reviews.text: I could not believe the price this was on sale for, 5TB forest than a 2TB and portable.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew O'Callaghan-Williamson

customer_reviews.title: What a bargain and fast drive too.
customer_reviews.text: What a life saver literally plug in and play no hassle, I now have the free space needed for my sons mass amount of games. Great product great price
customer_reviews.author: Scott E.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: As of yet no issues payed just over 200 bargain
customer_reviews.author: shane tomblin

customer_reviews.title: Yes yes yes !
customer_reviews.text: Very good and compact design. Fast and easy to use !
customer_reviews.author: Marek

customer_reviews.title: Works very well but...
customer_reviews.text: I use it as a ps4 hard drive. Works very well. The only but is the connection, you have to press quite hard to remove the cable. Tbh I always leave it connected to the ps4. No heat and no noice. Good product
customer_reviews.author: Ian Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Quite a let down
customer_reviews.text: Quite expensive for what it is and it makes a very annoying noise at regular intervals. Not of an adequate quality for its price. Returned
customer_reviews.author: M8792

customer_reviews.title: Solid. Looks good. Slightly better than other 5TB external drives.
customer_reviews.text: All tests were used with a USB 3.1 GEN2 port with provided cable. CrystalDiskInfo + CrystalDiskMark 5400RPM 5TB (4.54TB useable) was hoping for a 7200RPM model...I guess that's the 3.5 inch drives. The 'up to' 140MB/s claim was a bit aggressive. Amazon didn't add any additional protection to the shipping of this physical hard drive. Came in a bubble wrap bag and manufacturer packaging. Western Digital Packaging was nice. Rubber feet arent 100% sticky, will slide if pulled by the cord Not Impressed too much. $160 after taxes. Seagate MyBackup Plus 5TB is under $130.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: Works good so far and looks great. Only complaint is that it’s LOUD. Makes a constant humming noise that can get aggravating. Edit: set it on a mousepad and the sound is near silent
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Very good drives so far!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased five of the 5TB versions so far. I've received one bad cable, but I had a couple of extra cables so it didn't matter. The drives themselves have been great. I've written at least 2TB of data to each of them without problems. I bought them because until now the biggest external USB drive you could get that didn't require an external power supply was 2TB. Now it's up to 5TB and I'm replacing the old ones. I've had good luck over the years with WD.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barber

customer_reviews.title: Fails after 30 days. Amazon doesn't care.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute and utter trash. The drive started failing 30 days after purchased. I reformatted, same thing over and over. Tried new devices, never worked. Contacted amazon customer support to get a new one and after about 3 hours of back and forth, the ignorant, unskilled tech support said they weren't going to give me a refund or replacement. Absolute, trash. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: William Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Amazing HDD With Lots of Storage Space
customer_reviews.text: For the price and the simple fact that it is a "5 tb hard drive", this is ideal for anyone who wants a lot of storage for a good price and quality! This HDD should have enough space for more than a hundred games, perhaps up to 200 hundred. The write speeds are great as well! Being a hard drive... It is best to not be rough with it, moving parts and all. I haven't tested the durability, but it seems like it could withstand a drop or two.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: A very good drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 5TB drive for $119.99 while regular my passport costs $129.99. First impression: very very low vibration and noise compared with a 4TB mt passport from 2018. I cannot say any about reliability but I feel confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Just an okay 4.5TB drive
customer_reviews.text: It works just fine. Literally plug the one cable in and your Xbox will prompt you to format the drive. My complaints are this: the drive is called "Black" yet the major color of the device is white. Not a deal breaker, just annoying. The other complaint is this is not a 5TB drive — it is a 4.5TB drive. I understand that every drive ever does not have the stated capacity on the box due to system files. But this drive started out with 500GB already used. That's a huge number for a drive I just installed without an OS installed on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle G.

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5TB External Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I paid for 5TB and it was advertised for 5TB. It wasn't. When I first set it up, it was at 4.5TB as shown in the pictures. Other than the false advertisement, it does what it's suppose to do. It stores stuff. It would be nice if it could be used for console (Xbox) AND Windows because it's by the same company, Instructions states it can be used for only one device. 4 stars for the 4.5 storage capacity. 2 stars for the value of the money, because of the false advertisement. 5 stars for the sturdiness, because it seems sturdy. (I'm not about to purposely drop it on the floor to test it out.)
customer_reviews.author: DogSpelledBackwards

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy this useless piece of junk!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Hard drive 1/09/2020 and as of today 6/3/2020 is stopped working. I have had nothing but problems with this drive, having to reformat it about once a month because it would crash and now it is dead. This is the biggest piece of junk hard drive I have ever owned. I have plenty of Samsung and Seagate hard drives that are 5+ years old that still work no problem and this Western digital didn't even make it 6 full months. I will never buy a Western Digital hard drive again. Spend the extra money and get at Samsung or Seagate!!!
customer_reviews.author: Josh M.

customer_reviews.title: Restart console before formatting
customer_reviews.text: If you are trying to configure this product to consoles you must restart your console with product connected before formatting product. Your welcome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PS4 cannot detect
customer_reviews.text: Contacted manufacturer because the product is not being detected by the PS4, the item description suggests it is compatible however it does not work. Product specialist returned my email by suggesting a few quick fixes but they we’re unsuccessful. He then suggested I return the item. I’m really disappointed it didn’t work as described
customer_reviews.author: Steven Pitak

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival.
customer_reviews.text: Looks rugged as an ammo box, but delicate as an un-housed microswitch. Upon booting, I couldn't get it to connect with any of my PC's. Then I heard it. The slight *clicking* sound that those of us who have heard before instantly recognize as the sound of an HDD reading head smacking into the magnetic platters inside. Seems like a decent product, but based on my experience, this drive is not as tough as it looks. Treat it with care, brothas & sistahs.
customer_reviews.author: TimF

customer_reviews.title: So far So Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a good hard drive to purchase for the price and the number of games you can store is great. It also prevents me from deleting my old games. The only issue I had with this is hard drive was the initial setup of the hard drive it was just not plugged and play with little directions.
customer_reviews.author: Leona Brown-Straus, Founder of Enlighten LYFE Academy

customer_reviews.title: so far so good!
customer_reviews.text: works seamlessly on a PS4. upgraded from a 2TB external hard drive that was getting full, transferring via PS4 was simple but took a while. for reference, took anywhere from 40-70 minutes to transfer roughly ~450GB at a time -- wasn't too bad of a trade-off for an extra ~2.6TB.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: The Highest Quality Possible
customer_reviews.text: What makes this external HDD great is the build quality. WD obviously used the highest rated internal parts to make this HDD so fast and reliable. My son plugged this into his XBox One, and plug-n-play did the rest. Within a minute he was able to download new games onto it, and immediately started playing. This has the fastest USB read/write speeds compatible to gaming consoles, and for that reason alone, I highly recommend this model. I highly recommend this to friends and family looking to add HDD space to game consoles or for data backup of your personal files. I only write 100% honest reviews so hit that Helpful button if you like my review. Thank you. :)
customer_reviews.author: Solo Nur Ali

customer_reviews.title: with 2-Month Xbox Game Pass FALSE
customer_reviews.text: I paid $20 extra for the WD_Black 5TB P10 Game Drive for Xbox One only to find out that the codes expired last month. DO NOT PAY EXTRA FOR THIS VERSION IT"S A RIPOFF. The codes expired 6/20/20. Greatly disappointed in this, I purchased this for my son only to find out that I would have been better off purchasing two months game pass and the cheaper non xbox branded drive. No wear does it say in the description does it state that codes expire 6/20/20. Do not expect codes to work for your kids.
customer_reviews.author: Paul N

customer_reviews.title: You’re buying a 4.5 terabyte drive, not 5 as is advertised.
customer_reviews.text: It’s nice looking. Fast. But come on...5 HUNDRED gb lost to formatting!? Half a terabyte of a 5tb drive. That’s ridiculous. How companies who make hard drives continue to get away making these false claims baffles me.
customer_reviews.author: NonstickRon

customer_reviews.title: Sad that it doesn’t work, maybe I got a lemon?
customer_reviews.text: This product is ridiculous. It is made to look sturdy but it is not reliable and has first been unreadable until I restart, then had to repair the drive 2x, then now theres a clicking noise and won’t read! So Quality assurance has to be the issue, bc the reviews on this are good. I was surprised to see it is made in Thailand.
customer_reviews.author: Nathor Dread

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for both PS4 & Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one for my Xbox and one for my PS4, and they are perfect. They read immediately, and transferring the games from my internal drives to the external drives went very smoothly. I mounted them using 3M strips to the sides of the consoles to avoid them sliding around or not having a secure placement for them. They're very light and hold securely with the strips, which makes keeping the cord out of the way much easier and more visually pleasing. Would buy again for my family if they needed them.
customer_reviews.author: KingJ511

customer_reviews.title: Another WD drive that has failed
customer_reviews.text: This is the 6th WD hard drive that I have purchased. I keep buying these because they are cheap. I do mean that financially and I do mean that in quality. I will not be purchasing these again. Three of the drives have stopped being recognized on my computers. They do not offer any recovery assistance. They said, "we would please inform you that you should create multiple backups." I did not lose all my information because I do have other drives. However, I'm done buying 2 hard drives from WD based on their failure rate.
customer_reviews.author: Farty McFry

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Plugged it into my Xbox One X and it asked me to format it. Moved all my games over to this drive and then downloaded all the ones I wanted. I currently have 32 games installed and have about 2.5 - 3 GB left of space. Speeds seem faster than the internal hard drive. The only thing that's annoying is the drive went on sale the day after I bought it for about $30 off. Funny how that happens..........The drive is not noisy and it looks awesome. I went with the all-black version. It does not say Xbox one, only the white Xbox version one does.
customer_reviews.author: ATTICUScc04

customer_reviews.title: Works Seamlessly with Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: Needed more game storage capacity in conjunction with Game Pass. The drive connected easily to our Xbox and was super easy to configure. Have been using it for about 6 months with no issues. It does not seem to overheat and we do not notice any noise when it is active. Works great! Good storage capacity at a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Ctoffer

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to add storage to my Mac
customer_reviews.text: While this can be used for gaming, I needed to add storage to my Mac desktop with good reliability. I need to transport my content between work and home, and this suited my needs perfectly - no extra power supply required. Fast, Quiet, and (I bought the 2TB model) cost effective storage. Pre-formatted exFAT that both MAC and Windows recognize. Performance is virtually indistinguishable from my internal disk.
customer_reviews.author: Scott  Pederson

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy, fails in two days.
customer_reviews.text: I plugged it up to my MacBook Pro, to save school work on it & clear up some space & it literally only worked once (which is the day I got it). A day after that it completely went out. Great storage, easy to install but failed quicker then I’ve ever seen in my life! I even ordered another cord for it thinking that that was the problem & it still didn’t work. I also plugged it up to different laptops & my Xbox one S, no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: XBOX Game Pass Ultimate Expired on 6/20/20
customer_reviews.text: The memory capacity for this external HDD is great! However, it’s a bit misleading for the advertised XBOX One drive as the XBOX game pass ultimate it comes with just expired this past June 20, 2020 (I just ordered this yesterday). It’s still great though if you don’t need it as I got it for $119.99 compared to the other 5TB WD Black version which is $129.99 at the time of this writing.
customer_reviews.author: Aphrodite JC

customer_reviews.title: Great Backup Drive / Time Machine for Apple OS
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a plug 'n' play backup drive for my iMac running Mojave. The Apple tailored drives are pricier with less capacity. I'm using this with a partition. Journaled for the Time Machine side, and bootable APFS for the occasional "carbon copy" partition. I tested this with both the USB C (Thunderbolt 3) and USB 3.0, and in both cases the read/write speeds were comparable. Since the USB 3.0 was marginally faster, I'm using it instead of USB C. It amuses me that it's branded as a HDD for gaming. It's a high quality disk drive, and can be formatted and utilzed however you wish. This value of this WD_Black was greater than comparable WD drives intended for Apple.
customer_reviews.author: AMZN Loyalist

customer_reviews.title: Works extremely well
customer_reviews.text: Was a little worried due to the higher price vs other alternatives, but I'm extremely glad I got this. The storage space (I opted for 4TB) is an absolute lifesaver and I haven't had any reliability issues that seem to plague the alternatives. Getting the full advertised speeds as well which is a plus. I use this to store games, music, movies, and all kinds of files and it works great for them all.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Slow, slow, sloooooow
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the slowest drive I have ever experienced. When backing up my browser or email client one external drive does it in about 3 minutes this drive takes between 7 and 10 minutes. Had it for a few months and it seems to be getting slower with less than 20% used space.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Just plug in and play your heart out!
customer_reviews.text: (PS4) With games nowadays being 250gb+*ahem* *cod*...this is a definite must have! The storage capacity allows you to store all your favorite games and as well have peace in mind that you won’t have to delete a game/game data to make room. The install is literally the easiest thing, just plug in, go to memory settings and format it. Boom you’re all set. The rpm on this bad boy will allow you to spin up and start up any game just as fast as your PS4 can if not faster! Definitely recommend it to those that love keeping multiple games in file in case they decide to switch it up on game night.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Works well for Xbox one x
customer_reviews.text: Formatted quick and games launch faster than on the built in hdd! Update: Works so well that I bought a second one for my kid.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Cortez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Changing my review, It initially didn't work on my projector and I was really frustrated. I managed to get with WD's customer support and they figured my issue out which was that the drive had been formatted to work for both Windows and Macs. My projector was formatted specifically for Windows, so the guy walked me through the re-formatting and all is good now.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Contreras

customer_reviews.title: came on time but poorly packaged maybe
customer_reviews.text: Said 4.54 tb upon plug in. Unsure if that is good compared to others but it does need space to organize files so i get why that is. it came on my front porch on the ground, could have been placed but mostlikely tossed. super lightweight and not alotta packaging. really only the WD packaging which was just plastic shell. then the retail box. in a bubble bag / or box from Amazon i forgot but didnt think it was great. idk it works. id recommend if it was on sale again. i cant tell / notice if this model is faster or anything special.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Broken in 32 days
customer_reviews.text: Everything seemed great with this HDD until mine stopped registering game installs and won't be recognized by the Xbox. I am 2 days past the return window and this product is broken. I would strongly reconsider buying this, and do some more research.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 10 months
customer_reviews.text: Junk as usual from Western Digital. I used this as a gaming drive for my gaming laptop as the black drives seemed to be pretty good in my desktop. It was used maybe a few times a week when the kids would jump on the VR. Now it's doing the WD seeking dance. I miss the good old days of maxtor when drives lasted years not months.
customer_reviews.author: Impact9

customer_reviews.title: Third  & fourth WD drive that is dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: This disk is super slow after used for less than 1 day. Copy speed dropped from 120MB/s to 60MB/s and then to 20~30MB/s. Tested with DiskGenius and it shows many unhealthy sectors (pic 1). Very disappointed. This is the third WD drive I bought and all of them are DOA. Will never purchase WD again. Update: I got a replacement drive and it’s also DEFECTIVE! It has some serious compatibility issues with Mac! Pic 2 is when product just arrived, and pic 3 is after plugging in MacBook for just 1 minute and then eject. Somehow it just HURT ITSELF on Macs.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly stout for a commercial drive under $200
customer_reviews.text: I am an audio engineer and work with pro grade multi-TB hard drives all the time. The LaCie Rugged Mini drives are ubiquitous as are industrial grade Seagate and WD's own GForce series. These WD_Black drives are incredibly sturdy and stout for a much better per GB price tag. I bought this 5TB for my PS4 and I'm going to order a few more for my home recording set up, I'd have no worries taking these out in a backpack or transporting them around a lot. Very surprised and very pleased. Highly recommended...
customer_reviews.author: JRSIV Music Ltd.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty great hard drive super easy to get going. My only issue with it is that it will take slightly longer for my steam app to run and even load games. But the tradeoff to have 5tb instead of my 500gb IHD is well worth the extra seconds of load time I must wait but it still adds up and you really notice especially when games would load near instantly and I'm talking huge games like RDR2.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great HDD
customer_reviews.text: Works out of the box with no formatting needed. Actually storage capacity is around 4.4 to 4.5 TB. So far the HDD has worked flawlessly. The case is very nice and sturdy. The value is a little on the steep side of things because you can get other WD HDD'S with 5 TB for around 89 to 99 dollars that will do the same thing. I picked this one up for 114.99 and that was on sale. I think you are paying for the brand, the xbox logo, and the 2 months of game pass ultimate. The ultimate makes up for the 114.99 as it costs 14.99 a month. Overall I am very pleased with this HDD.
customer_reviews.author: j dog

customer_reviews.title: As good as advertised for PS4
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my ps4 for extra storage. Worked great with it. Ps4 recognized it then formatted it and have had zero issues with it. Games run smoothly can't tell any difference between games on it and on the ps4 harddrive. One complaint though not a major one the supplied cable is really really short. I've only had this for a couple months so I can't comment on how it will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy read the review!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk. It worked for about a week and then it just started disconnecting out of nowhere then it would reconnect and then a minute later disconnect again. Thought that maybe it was just a bad hard drive so i ordered another one bit the same thing started happening with that one. I was able to send both back for a refund so that was good. I would not recommend this product or brand to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Nielly

customer_reviews.title: Comes partitioned due to size limits
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that this drive comes as a MBR disk. Translation: It's too big to be seen all as one disk, so it had to be partitioned. To get around this, use Computer Management/Disk Management (in Windows 10) to convert the disk to GPT. Note that all data will be erased when doing so.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Performance
customer_reviews.text: Connected to a USB 3.2 Gen 2 port. It is as fast in read/ write as the internal drives in my gaming laptop. With 5 TB or storage available, I have moved my Steam library to the external drive, and use the NVME M.3 card to store frequently played games and otter applications. Now, I do not have to decide which games to load for playing when traveling overseas. I highly recommend this product for use an an external gaming drive for PC.
customer_reviews.author: Xmerwynd

customer_reviews.title: Quit Working In Less Than Six Months!!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk! Stopped working after less than 6 months. One day it worked, the next day it didn't. It's way too expensive to have to replace every six months! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Queen B

customer_reviews.title: Great drive but you DO have to reformat it for a computer
customer_reviews.text: The device is formatted for a game box or something and the sector size is like a MEGABYTE which means that a tiny 50 byte file takes up a megabyte of storage unless you first reformat the drive with a more reasonable sector size, which DOES turn out to be very easy to do. Speed is quite respectable. I've only been using it for a few weeks so I can't comment on the long-term reliability but should it have problems, I'll be back to update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hinds

customer_reviews.title: So far good
customer_reviews.text: Don't think I have any real issues it didn't quite come with a full five but it's because it already has stuff stored on to it which is why you don't get the full five terabytes I have quite a few games stored onto it along with some programs for school and it's been working great as long as it doesn't die like the one that died in my hard drive in my computer I will be a happy Camper. Also I really do like the design is very lightweight it's small and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for Xbox One. Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 5tb drive, which was a smoking deal. I plugged it into my Xbox One, it saw it right away and I was downloading games in just a few minutes. It is powered off the Xbox and it is extremely quiet and does not get hot., I love it.
customer_reviews.author: James Heide

customer_reviews.title: A great match for modern game systems.
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect set up for Xbox. Once the Xbox formatted the WD HDD, it was ready to go as the primary game saving method. My Xbox took longer to download update than setting up the HDD. The design of the HDD is superb with the rugged edges and metal top to dissipate heat (I’m assuming aluminum). Not that it’ll go anywhere other than sit next to the Xbox but it gives it a tough and professional look with all your other media equipment. The indicator light is great too as it doesn’t blind you.
customer_reviews.author: jorge

customer_reviews.title: Great for storage
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use for file storage - picked these based on mostly positive reviews and good price compared to similar offerings and models. Works great and quality was good. Easy to use and the compatibility with a lot of different types of systems is nice. Overall would recommend. Blessings!
customer_reviews.author: A Branch

customer_reviews.title: Edgy, industrial design in compact form factor
customer_reviews.text: Unique design, edgy and slightly industrial, the P10 line definitely stands out from the competition and arguably does not have to only be marketed towards gamers. We use these as backup units in our studio and they work fantastically well and look the part as well. Would only wish for USB-C ports and preferably of the Gen II or USB 3.2 specification.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Maloney

customer_reviews.title: Good size and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Bought this drive to expand the storage from my PS4. Now I can finally play the games that require extra drive space and not have any lags. You do have to plug into the left port if horizontal/top port if using vertical stand. Will not read if you use the other port. Once plugged into the PS4 was easy to format and transfer data onto. Space is adequate unless you’re a heavy gamer and download a lot of content. Y can always get additional drives if you run out of space, and for the price, you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso Tobias

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap and you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I needed to expand the capacity of an Xbox One - plug and play. I read several reviews and while this was one of the more expensive options, I will say you get what you pay for. Perfect addition. FAST drive, lots of space to store games. You do have to tell Xbox to format it, but I suspect that's going to be the case with any hard drive to make it compatible with their file structure. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: TechDad99

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming but....
customer_reviews.text: Great value for our two xboxes however very disappointed that the two month game pass had been expired for quite some time and wanting to receive the game pass trial was one of the main reasons I chose to purchase this item. Having said that the Overall product is good.
customer_reviews.author: Dolfyndance

customer_reviews.title: Used as a media server
customer_reviews.text: I got this drive to use as a media server. I have it hooked up to my Mac, use the PLEX app and I can watch it on both my Roku boxes in the house plus on our phones wherever we are. The drive performs awesome for this. Never any lag. I plan on ordering another as this one is already almost full. Lots of things to watch out there, and with everyone having to stay home, the media server is a great solution. This drive is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Z

customer_reviews.title: It actually can hold it's own up against and SSD drive to and extent.Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: It's not and SSD but it works well and seems to be pretty fast and was a very easy plug and play type harddrive for my xbox one x.Great price compared to buying 2 SSD 1TB drives for over 2 hundred dollars and actually this harddrive is cheaper and it's not all that slow except for the fact that I download quite alot of games at once cause of my xbox gold membership that would slow down even and ssd drive.I think it's a very nice harddrive and recieved it very quick and Thank you very much for that. Not and ssd drive but more room and at a better price and it runs well
customer_reviews.author: dennis

customer_reviews.title: Odd marketing, but still great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after buying the Seagate Backup Plus. That thing is a mess, achieving 60 MB/s burst and then craps out. The P10 "G4M3 DR1V3", while I disagree with how its marketed, performs exceptionally well. I was able to transfer 4 TB of data with 120 MB/s sustained speeds, over a course of 8 hours! In a way, I guess the marketing is on point, as games usually consist large data files.
customer_reviews.author: CHJC

customer_reviews.title: Speedy and Roomy Storage for PS4 Pro
customer_reviews.text: I got the 5 TB model to run on a PS4 Pro. So far, it is a great external HD. I got it to replace an older 2 TB WD Passport. Just needed more space. Formatting the new drive as an external PS4 HD was much faster than expected. It is whisper quiet. I can't even hear it when the PS4 is in rest mode and downloading a big update or a new game to the external HD. Write and read speeds are super quick. Noticeably faster than my old Passport HD. Overall, I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Siege

customer_reviews.title: Necessity in this day and age
customer_reviews.text: First external hard drive for my systems, but it's basically a necessity at some point if you play a lot. Got sick of uninstalling games to make space. The latest call of duty is over 200gb alone. I've only tried it on my PS4 so far, but it was recognized immediately and files automatically will load to it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Durable excellent external extended storage for ps4.
customer_reviews.text: Works. Delivery to door. Bubble wrap packaging was a bit worrisome. I would rather have it packed in a box for more protection during shipping, however still works since it seems well designed and tough. It was made for portability, excellent for extending ps4 storage. I think there is an option for additional packaging by Amazon which I wish I had opted for piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent PS4 external storage expansion drive
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. I needed to add more storage to my PS4 and this was perfect for the price. Installation was as easy as Plug & Play, it has great performance and looks great with its rugged style casing for my game storage. I would definitely buy this again and highly recommend it for gamers out there looking to expand the storage capacity of their game system
customer_reviews.author: Angel Muniz

customer_reviews.title: Drive is slower on my system than the WD Elements Portable Drive they were purchased to replace.
customer_reviews.text: Drive is slower on my system than the WD Elements Portable Drive they were purchased to replace. These drives also make more noise than the drive they are replacing. Extremely disappointed. WD can usually be relied upon for solid products, but not this time.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Pappy

customer_reviews.title: Made cheap honestly
customer_reviews.text: I hope its not to late to worn people that are getting ready to purchase this.Dont buy this. This is my first negative review on amazon and i buy products almost everyday. After hours of downloading games and a few months of little use it stoped working. I looked at it and im no expert but the way it plugs in the hard drive is cheap and loose parts.im not sure if thats the reason it failed but i do know that i should of just purched a different brand payed more or less this brand sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Stolzman

customer_reviews.title: Great option and price but isn’t any faster than others.
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a lightning deal a few weeks ago for less than $100 it works great for my Xbox one. It is only 5400 rpm which as a “black product” I would of expected 7200 rpm. So it’s really not any more special than a different external WD drive. Side note if your buying this to pull the drive out of the housing you’re out of luck it is WD’s newer style USB only drive.
customer_reviews.author: GingerSnap

customer_reviews.title: Pay For Storage
customer_reviews.text: When I was scrolling on amazon, I had found that it was hard to find a 5 TB hard drive to use across platforms, I stumbled across the WD and found one that was the same price at the 4 TB hard drive. Lo behold I found out that it only had 4.54 usable TB on it. without the extra space on there, being able to go across platforms from Xbox games which used half a TB on a good day, to more, It made it a little more difficult. Still it is very fast and works for what I use it for, I just suggest they put the usage on it to make it confirmed 5 TB.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Works great for ps4
customer_reviews.text: This came with 3 step guide where to go to format the drive for console. Took maybe 5 minutes or less to format. Great for adding a ton of more games since the biggest i can put in my system without doing some weird boot system i know of is 2 tb. Came with short usb 3.0 cable I highly recommend this over segate 6tb one since made specifically for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Give me space!
customer_reviews.text: Easy set-up! Still installing games on mine from my ps4. Haven't tested it yet but I'm sure it'll work. (Will update if necessary) been needing an external HD for a while decided to buy one because i need more space. Anyone with a console knows the struggle. Lol this one was preferred over an overpriced one with the same specs for a logo on it, so i went with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kipp Baker

customer_reviews.title: Modest performance and good value for a portable drive
customer_reviews.text: I seem to get better performance than others have with my drive hitting near the max of 140mbs. Bought mine for my xbox one s. I haven't noticed much of a performance difference vs the SATA II internal but still playing with it. This drive DOES come with a USB 3 cable, though the product does not make mention of it. Its nice to have a larger drive with decent performance that doesnt need external power, and it's even nicer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Livingstone

customer_reviews.title: Fast. WD 2TB for Xbox One S.
customer_reviews.text: Unboxed the WD P10 2TB external hard drive. Plugged the provided usb 3.0 to Xbox One S, turned the console on. Was the easiest install ever! I had to download a game to see it working. Very fast. Should have bought sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Si Fu Preston Collins Jr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and best external hard drive you can get.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product.. does the job well. After this one i will purchase the 8TB. The product/item is really strong and durable. Great quality material. Well build. Does not make any sound while on use. Easy to use and and connect, best external hard drive that ive used so far. Will probably stick to this brand but with higher capacity. Hope i get a good deal on the the higher TB.
customer_reviews.author: christopher perez

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Okay, this is a great product. I'm someone who uses a fair amount of storage devices and I bought and use one of these for about a month now. Speed is great and no loading issues at all. I have 3 of these now and will probably stay with their products for the furure
customer_reviews.author: Michael Casillas

customer_reviews.title: Ps4 working great
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive works beautiful, i bought the 5 tb model and i use ot with a PS4 right now i have downloaded my whole ps library since 2014. It is not noisy. It is easy to install. It runs the games like a normal disc. Easy to disconnect and travel with.
customer_reviews.author: fernando

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for Xbox One / Xbox One X
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly on my Xbox One X. Small, quiet, and fast. Add 500% storage capacity for under a $130! Plug and play, just plug in the supplied cord into the drive and your Xbox and you'll be prompted with a message asking if you want to format it for videos and pictures or for storage of your games. Pick your selection and in seconds you're ready to go. A 5 year old could set this up.
customer_reviews.author: brian m.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little External
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed external drive. Western Digital has really never let me down in all the years of using their products. Would highly recommend this drive for quality and price
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Best external/portable Xbox one X hard drive.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first external hard drive for my Xbox one X. It has performed flawlessly. It is fast enough to load any large game in the same amount of time or faster than the internal hard drive. I play mostly triple A titles, which require a LOT of space, and with 67 games downloaded and all on the WD Black; I'm only using 2/3 of the external space. Highly recommend if you're into triple A titles or even if you're an Xbox Gamepass member.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for your gaming setup
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of storage + affordable + plug-and-play simplicity = a great buy! If you are tired of constantly having to delete and re-download large games because your 500GB internal storage just isn't cutting it, then you need this! We have horrible download speeds at my house, so being able to store all of my large game files without having to download them for hours every time I want to play has been a game changer (no pun intended). No more shuffling large games around on your internal hard drive! Just plug this sucker in, download your games, and never think about it again!
customer_reviews.author: James S.

product_meta.title: WD_BLACK 2 TB P10 Game Drive for On-The-Go Access To Your Game Library - Works with Console or PC
product_meta.description: Capacity:2 TB| Style Name:Portable HDD| Pattern Name:Console or PCThe wd_black P10 game Drive gives your console or PC The Performance-Enhancing tools It needs to keep your competitive edge. Its a top-tier external HDD in capacities up to 5TB, built specifically for gamers looking to expand the potential of their console or PC by saving their game library in an on-the-go form factor. Now, with wd_black P10 game Drive, you can drive your game The way you choose.
feature_bullets: Up to 5TB that can hold up to 125 Games, so that you can save old favorites and still have room for new titles
Portable and durable form factor that provides fast access to your gaming library, anywhere you go
High-performance HDD to optimize your console or PC gaming experience and drive your game
Purpose-built for gamers based on wd_black quality and reliability so you can play without limits

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,283 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
